meanings.sent1: The leaseholds in the city are mostly apartments.
meanings.sent2: She inherited several leaseholds from her grandparents.
meanings.sent3: The leaseholds in the neighborhood all have beautiful gardens.
meanings.sent4: His leaseholds were like pieces of a puzzle, fitting perfectly together.
meanings.sent5: The leaseholds by the lake offer stunning views of the sunset.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of holding property under a lease.
meanings.sent1: The leaseholds of the tenants were secure for many years.
meanings.sent2: He was responsible for managing the leaseholds of the company.
meanings.sent3: The leaseholds of the building seemed to have a party of their own.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, the leaseholds were like little kingdoms waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The leaseholds' value increased as the demand for rentals grew.
